definitions: A mandala (Sanskrit lit. 'circle', [ˈmɐɳɖɐlɐ]) is a geometric configuration of symbols. In various spiritual traditions, mandalas may be employed for focusing attention of practitioners and adepts, as a spiritual guidance tool, for establishing a sacred space and as an aid to meditation and trance induction. In spiritual or religious process, a mandala is a period of approximately 40 days in which time the human system completes one physiological cycle.
